reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Reducing HIV infections and HIV related mortality among Somalis

description.narrative: Somalia - HIV - United Nations Children's Fund - UNICEF. This program has the following goals: By 2023, reduce the rate of new infections by 30%. By 2023, reduce HIV related mortality and morbidity for Somali women, men and children by 30%. The objectives of this program are: By 2023 increase the percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status to over 75%. By 2023, increase the percentage of other vulnerable populations who have received a HIV test during the reporting period to 80%. By 2023, increase the percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV to over 46%. By 2023, increase the percentage of people living with HIV on ART who are virologically suppressed to 89%. By 2023, increase the percentage of people living with HIV who are newly initiated on ART screened for TB to 85%. By 2023, reduce the rate percentage of people living with HIV who report experiences of HIV-related discrimination in health-care settings to 30% or below.

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for SOM-H-UNICEF
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive results among the total HIV tests performed during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Number of women and men aged 15+ who received an HIV test and know their results
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Impact indicator for SOM-H-UNICEF
HIV incidence among 15-49 age group
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
Percentage of other vulnerable populations (specify) who are living with HIV
Outcome indicator for SOM-H-UNICEF
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed

Percentage of people living with HIV not on ART at the end of the reporting period among people living with HIV who were either on ART at the end of the last reporting period or newly initiated on ART during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV who report experiences of HIV-related discrimination in health-care settings
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of (estimated) people living with HIV who have been tested HIV-positive
Percentage of other vulnerable populations who report the use of a condom at last sexual intercourse
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
